1. By default, only output failed tests
2. When -v/--verbose is passed, output all tests (current behavior)

Let me first review the last commit as per the working process, then look at the current harness implementation.

commit 51942f78835ab29bf6a154d22161434b1245783e
Author: Dario Hamidi <dario.hamidi@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Dec 21 23:39:22 2025 +0200

    Document shimmering rules in interp/AGENTS.md
    
    Added encapsulation rules for TCL object shimmering:
    - Centralized Get* methods for type conversions
    - Rules for adding new representations
    - C callbacks must delegate to these methods
    
    ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

content.thinking:
I can see the harness command uses the `harness.Run` function with a `harness.Config`. I need to look at the harness package to understand how test output is currently handled, then add verbose flag support.

Let me check the harness package.

content.text: Let me look at the harness package to understand the current output behavior:

content.thinking: Let me look at the harness.go file to see the Config struct and the Run function, and also the reporter to understand how output is generated.

content.content:
1â†’package harness
     2â†’
     3â†’import (
     4â†’	"fmt"
     5â†’	"io"
     6â†’)
     7â†’
     8â†’// Config holds the configuration for running the harness.
     9â†’type Config struct {
    10â†’	HostPath  string
    11â†’	TestPaths []string
    12â†’	Output    io.Writer
    13â†’	ErrOutput io.Writer
    14â†’}
    15â†’
    16â†’// Run executes the test harness with the given configuration.
    17â†’// Returns the number of failed tests.
    18â†’func Run(cfg Config) int {
    19â†’	testFiles, err := CollectTestFiles(cfg.TestPaths)
    20â†’	if err != nil {
    21â†’		fmt.Fprintf(cfg.ErrOutput, "error: %v\n", err)
    22â†’		return 1
    23â†’	}
    24â†’
    25â†’	if len(testFiles) == 0 {
    26â†’		fmt.Fprintln(cfg.ErrOutput, "error: no test files found")
    27â†’		return 1
    28â†’	}
    29â†’
    30â†’	runner := NewRunner(cfg.HostPath, cfg.Output)
    31â†’	reporter := NewReporter(cfg.Output)
    32â†’	var allResults []TestResult
    33â†’	hasErrors := false
    34â†’
    35â†’	for _, testFile := range testFiles {
    36â†’		suite, err := ParseFile(testFile)
    37â†’		if err != nil {
    38â†’			fmt.Fprintf(cfg.ErrOutput, "error parsing %s: %v\n", testFile, err)
    39â†’			hasErrors = true
    40â†’			continue
    41â†’		}
    42â†’
    43â†’		results := runner.RunSuite(suite)
    44â†’		allResults = append(allResults, results...)
    45â†’
    46â†’		for _, result := range results {
    47â†’			reporter.ReportResult(testFile, result)
    48â†’		}
    49â†’	}
    50â†’
    51â†’	summary := Summarize(allResults)
    52â†’	reporter.ReportSummary(summary)
    53â†’
    54â†’	if hasErrors || summary.Failed > 0 {
    55â†’		return 1
    56â†’	}
    57â†’	return 0
    58â†’}
    59â†’

2. Pass the verbose flag to `NewReporter`
3. Modify `ReportResult` to only output passing tests when verbose is enabled
4. Add the `-v/--verbose` flag to the command in main.go

Let me make these changes.

- Default mode shows only the summary (132 tests, 132 passed, 0 failed)
- Verbose mode shows all PASS/FAIL lines

The implementation is complete. Let me also check the --help output to make sure the flag is documented.

input.command:
git add harness/cmd/harness/main.go harness/harness.go harness/reporter.go && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
Add verbose flag to test harness

By default, the harness now only outputs failed tests to reduce noise
as the test suite grows. Pass -v/--verbose to see all test results.

Changes:
- Config.Verbose field controls output behavior
- Reporter only prints PASS results when Verbose is true
- CLI exposes -v/--verbose flag

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)" && git status
